Class App

java.lang.Object
App
public class App extends Object
Black Jack final project. This is the main app that has the logic and interfacing for a game of blackjack.
Since:
11-20-25
Author:
Charlie Kavich

  • Field Details

    • shoeSize

      private static final int shoeSize
      This is an integer representing the amount of cards in the full 6 decks that make of a shoe for casino blackjack. Once the shoe array list called deck is less than half of the total shoe size in this int, it will be refreshed.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • deck

      private static ArrayList<Card> deck
      This is an array list of cards representing the 6 decks that make up the shoe. It is literally just an array list that will be initialized with 6 full decks of playing cards represented by the card class. I should have named it shoe, but by the time I thought about it, it was already implemented in a bunch of places as deck.

    • playerHand

      private static ArrayList<Card> playerHand
      This is an array list that represents the player's hand of cards. The cards are represented by the card class.

    • compHand

      private static ArrayList<Card> compHand
      This is an array list that represents the computer/dealer's hand of cards. The cards are represented by the card class.

    • random

      private static Random random
      Instance variable for my random object so I don't have to repeatedly declare new ones.

    • in

      private static Scanner in
      Instance variable for my scanner object so I don't have to repeatedly declare new ones.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception
      Throws:
      Exception

    • gameEndAndDealerAction

      public static void gameEndAndDealerAction()
      This method is where the logic of who wins and the dealers actions reside. If the player doesn't bust, the dealer will hit until they value of their hand is greater than 17 or they bust. In the case neither the player or dealer busts, whichever hand is closer to 21 wins. In the case of a tie, a tie message will present itself.

    • displayPlayerHand

      public static void displayPlayerHand()
      This method simply displays the cards in your hand and their total value.

    • displayCompHand

      public static void displayCompHand(boolean ready)
      This method displays the dealers hand. Before the player makes their actions the dealer's first card is hidden. After the player is done making decisions, the dealer reveals the hidden card.
      Parameters:
      ready - this boolean reprents whether or not the dealer is ready to reveal the hidden card.

    • handInitialize

      public static void handInitialize()
      Initializes the hands for the beginning of a round of blackjack by clearing whatever was in the hands and adding 2 cards for both the player and the dealer.

    • handStateCheck

      public static int handStateCheck(ArrayList<Card> hand)
      This method checks a hand to see what state it is in of which there are three. The first is blackjack, the second is playable, and the third is busted. This method also will update the value of the hand for the Ace rule. The ace is 11 by default, but if it prevents you from busting, its value will go to 1.
      Parameters:
      hand - the array list of cards which you are checking the handstate of
      Returns:
      a 0 means the hand is a black jack, a 1 means the hand is still playable, and a 2 means the hand is a bust.

    • handTotal

      public static int handTotal(ArrayList<Card> hand)
      Computes the total value of the hand specified by the parameter.
      Parameters:
      hand - the array list for the total value of the cards to be calculated
      Returns:
      the total value of the hand

    • addCard

      public static void addCard(ArrayList<Card> hand)
      Adds a card to the hand and removes it from the shoe.
      Parameters:
      hand - the hand arraylist of cards that the card is being added to.

    • initializeDeck

      public static void initializeDeck()
      Initializes the shoe by adding 6 decks of playing cards worth of card objects to the deck array list.
